thread.title: Jay Z Makes Approach To Sign Premier League Wonderkid To His Agency
thread.title_full: Jay Z Makes Approach To Sign Premier League Wonderkid To His Agency

title: Jay Z Makes Approach To Sign Premier League Wonderkid To His Agency
text:
Jay Z Makes Approach To Sign Premier League Wonderkid To His Agency Mon Feb 13 2017 23:39:00   23:39:00 GMT+0000 (GMT) TheSPORTbible football 
Back in 2013, Jay Z opened his sports management company Roc Nation Sports, a 'dedicated sports representation for professional athletes', according to their official website. 
Roc Nation already has 33 clients signed up from six different sports, and now global artist Jay Z is looking to add Manchester United youngster Roshaun Williams to his growing agency. 
The only footballer to link up with Jay Z and Roc Nation Sports is Bayern Munich defender Jerome Boateng, but now it is being reported that 18-year-old Williams has been approached by the sports management company. 
A source told The Sun : "Everyone's trying to sign Roshaun because he looks like he is going to be the next big talent for England. 
"The move from Jay Z has got all the football world talking because it's a big statement of how he sees his company's future. 
"He has a big role in the company and football is an obvious market for him to get into with his sports business." 
Former Manchester United boss Louis van Gaal included Roshaun Williams in the first team squad to face West Ham back in March for their FA Cup quarter final tie. 
Williams broke into the U18s as U15 squad member and made his U21 debut as a 16-year-old. Roshaun Williams and Regan Poole both start as England u19s face Wales u19s 
A real talent for the future.(H/T: The Sun )
